frame.name: Locale
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains general locale words, and is mostly a place-holder in the hierarchy. Words in this frame designate relatively stable bounded ares of the world which have permanent <fen>Relative_location</fen>s with respect to other locales, and thus are useful as permanent landmarks.
It is inherited by Locale_by_use, which has to do with places that are named according to their intended use, or some habitual use, such as factory.n, dance floor.n, village.n, field.n. It is also inherited by Locale_by_event, which covers places that are names according to some event which took place there, such as concerts, battles, and meteor impacts.
<ex>This is a <fex name="Descriptor">pleasant</fex> <fex name="Locale"><t>area</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Locale
FE.definition:
<def-root>A stable bounded area. It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
<ex>There used to be a forest in that <t>area</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Constituent_parts
FE.definition: <def-root>Salient parts that make up a <fen>Locale</fen>. <ex>This is the largest <fex name="Cnst">live oak</fex> <t>area</t> in the forest.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>A place that a <fen>Locale</fen> is located with respect to.
<ex>For some reason, the <t>place</t> <fex name="rel">next to the lamp</fex> was damp.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Formational_cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>Indicates the action (or causer) which brings the features of the <fen>Locale</fen> about. This FE should also include words that indicate that there was no salient formation.
<ex>In an official <fex name="for">"Defense of the Pedestrian Act"</fex> <t>zone</t>, all forms of wheeled transport (excluding wheelchairs) are prohibited.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Container_possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>The location that the Locale is a part of. <ex>John spent several years wandering the northern <t>regions</t> <fex name="ContP">of Europe</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>ULTIMATELY TO BE REPLACED BY MULTIWORD TARGETS (in almost all cases). This FE is used for the Names of Locales. </def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Descriptor is a temporary condition of the <fen>Locale</fen>.
<ex>The day after the hurricane, the prime minister visited the <fex name="des">devastated</fex> <t>area</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Related_event
FE.definition: <def-root>An event related to the locale in some way other than (1) Formational_cause (which is a separate FE) or an intended use (which would place the instance in Locale_by_use), or (3) a defining event (which would place the instance in Locale_by_event).</def-root>

FE.name: Inherent_purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The activity that is carried out in the <fen>Locale</fen>.</def-root>
